1.Meansofabstraction: A river intake and 3 no. Pumps having a capacity of 90.92 cubic metres per minute each.
1.Meansofmeasurement:
(i) No abstraction shall take place unless the Licence Holder has installed a meter to measure quantities of water abstracted.
(ii) The Licence Holder shall position and install the meter in accordance with any written directions given by the Agency.
(iii) The Licence Holder shall maintain, repair or replace the meter to ensure that accurate measurements are recorded at all times.Â 
(iv) The Licence Holder shall keep all records of meter repair or replacement including evidence of current certification for a period of 6 years.
1.handsOffFlowDescfull: This water abstraction licence currently has no flow condition.
1.MaximumQuantityofwatertobeabstracted:
11,069.51 cubic metres per hour
217,398.80 cubic metres per day
61,234,620.00 cubic metres per year
1.records: The Licence Holder shall take and record readings of the meter specified in condition 7 at the same time each month during the whole of the period during which abstraction is authorised or as otherwise approved in writing by the Agency.       Each record shall be kept and be made available during all reasonable hours for inspection by the Agency for at least 7 years.       A copy of the record or summary data from it shall be sent to the Agency within 28 days of 31 March in  each year or within 28 days of being so directed in writing by the Agency.

2.SourceofSupply: Underground strata comprising of Mercia Mudstone at Anarea, Atown.
2.Pointofabstraction: Within the area marked hatched on the map and not outside the boundary formed by straight lines running between the following National Grid References:-SK 496333, SK 4963444, SK 496309555, SK 496366
2.Meansofmeasurement: The Licence Holder shall use a meter to measure quantities of water abstracted. The Licence Holder shall provide and install the meter before any abstraction takes place. The Licence Holder shall position and install the meter in accordance with any written directions given by the Agency. The Licence Holder shall maintain the meter in such a condition, and if necessary replace it, so as to measure quantities of water abstracted accurately and efficiently. The Licence Holder shall calibrate it regularly, in accordance with the recommendations of the manufacturer or at any time required by the Agency, and shall replace it as necessary. The Licence Holder shall retain evidence of current certification for inspection by the Agency.  The Agency may have regard to its Abstraction Metering Good Practice Manual (or equivalent guidance) in directing any of the following: where the meter should be located or how it should be installed; whether the meter measures accurately, and efficiently and is properly maintained; whether it is necessary to require repair or replacement of the meter.
2.Meansofabstraction: Up to 40 jet wells not exceeding approximately 6 meters in depth and 51 millimetres in diameter.
2.PeriodofAbstraction: During the months March to November inclusive each year.
2.handsOffFlowDescfull: This water abstraction licence currently has no flow condition.
2.MaximumQuantityofwatertobeabstracted: 1,820 cubic metres per day 633,200 cubic metres Per Year
2.records: The Licence Holder shall take and record readings of the meter specified in condition 7 at the same time each month during the whole of the period during which abstraction is authorised or as otherwise approved in writing by the Agency. Each record shall be kept and be made available during all reasonable hours for inspection by the Agency for at least 6 years.

3.SourceofSupply: Underground strata comprising of Chalk at Accrington, Lancashire.
3.Meansofmeasurement: The Licence Holder shall use a flow meter to measure quantities of water abstracted. The licence Holder shall provide and install the meter before any abstraction takes place. The licence holder shall maintain the meter in a condition so as to measure quantities of wter abstracted accurately and effeciently, shall calibrate it reguarly, in accordance with the recommendeations of the manufactures or at any time when required by the Agency, and shall replace it as necessary. The Licence Holder shall retain evidence of current certification for inspection by the Agency. The Agency will have regard to its Abstraction Metering Good Practive Manual (or equivalent guidance) in directing where the meter should be located or how it should be installed, in determine whether the meter measures accurately and effeciently and is properly maintained and in judging whether it is necessary to require repair or replacement of the meter.
3.handsOffFlowHelp: Learn how this affects the amount you can abstract
3.handsOffFlowDescfull: CESSATION CONDITION No abstraction shall take place during the year after the current year if the level of surface water at the location indicated on the map is greater than or equal to [34.06m AODN] in March of the current year. Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Agency. The Agency will be responsible for informing the Licence Holder in reasonable time prior to the start of the abstraction period whether conditions are suitable to take place. Note: A year for this condition is defined as being from the 1 January and 31 December in any year.
3.MaximumQuantityofwatertobeabstracted:
14.4 cubic metres per hour
200 cubic metres per day
10,000 cubic metres per year
At an instantaneous rate not exceeding 4 litres per second.

Note: An hour means any period of 60 consecutive minutes, a day means any period of 24 consecutive hours and a year means the 12 month period beginning on 1 April and ending on 31 March.
3.records: The Licence Holder shall take and record readings of the meter specified in condition 7 at the same time each month during the whole of the period during which abstraction is authorised or as otherwise approved in writing by the Agency. Each record shall be kept and be made available during all reasonable hours for inspection by the Agency for at least 6 years. The Licence Holder shall send a copy of the record or summary data from it to the Agency within 28 calendar days of 31 March in each year or within 28 days of being so directed in writing by the Agency.
